docs.lead_paragraph: The first apparently successful drug treatment for a widespread form of venereal disease has been reported by two University of Pennsylvania researchers in the current issue of The Journal of the American Medical Association.

headline.main: First Apparent Success Reported In Treatment for a Form of V.D.; Drug Still Experimental

docs.abstract: Penna Univ Drs Herbert A Blough and Robert L Giuntoli rept success in treating genital herpes simplex (venereal infection) with drug 2-deoxy-D-glucose; describe testing (S)
docs.snippet: The first apparently successful drug treatment for a widespread form of venereal disease has been reported by two University of Pennsylvania researchers in the current issue of The Journal of the American Medical Association.

byline.original: By LAWRENCE K. ALTMAN Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: IN Mexico, travelers know it as turista, Montezuma's revenge and the Aztec two-step. It has many names in many countries, most of them amusing euphemisms.
docs.abstract: Advice to travelers on preventing and treating diarrhea (M)
